Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the individual had the opportunity to vote to give the president limited authority to begin strikes against terrorists in Iraq and Syria.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed up by the actual voting record of the individual.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the individual voted to give the president limited authority to begin strikes against terrorists in Iraq and Syria.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it misstates what the individual was actually voting on.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the individual was actually voting on providing training and supplies to the Syrian rebels, not authorizing strikes against terrorists in Iraq and Syria.
